alert.note: Alert for Chippewa; Pope; Stevens; Swift (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 29 at 5:41AM CDT by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Pope, northeastern Chippewa, eastern Stevens and Swift Counties through 615 AM CDT... At 540 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles northeast of Lake Oliver to 8 miles northwest of Clara City. Movement was northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Hancock, Kerkhoven and Murdock around 555 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Cyrus. This includes the following highways... U.S. Highway 12 between mile markers 27 and 58. U.S. Highway 59 between mile markers 145 and 177. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
